page.title: 08HISTORIC BUILDINGS IN RIPON
page.content:
RIPON CATHEDRAL cont... Archbishop Roger of York is the main architect of the present building,the west front is the work of Walter De Gray The south east corner of the central tower collapsed about 1450 and left it unusable for some years.The choir stalls were finished in 1494.Compared with many Cathedrals,Ripon is very light and spacious due to the rebuilding of the nave in 1500 A.D.
THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION, This building was a prison and is now used as a prison museum showing all the old torture instruments and the methods of punishment that the Victorians used,such as the"treadmill" and the"crank".
